pages.text: primitive places I've ever seen. Luckily it didn't drain too much of the available energy to form the portal here, since there doesn't appear to be much in the way of usable resources.$(br)The natives are animalistic and hungry, and none of them appear able to converse in any meaningful form.

I suspect I won't end up staying here long, perhaps just long enough to firmly rule out the potential for any useful materials.$(br2)Regardless, I'm mostly just astounded that the portal sequence continues to work. The frame gives no indication of deterioration or failure and the key continues to remain stable even after imparting its signature onto the portal frame.

Before I leave, I need to look a little closer into this skeletal horn object I was able to piece together from fragments of bones I found buried around. Its sound imitates an animal call I've heard before here$(br)but I haven't yet been able to match its originating creature.
